Table of Contents

Enum LogicalOperator

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Enums
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Specifies the logical operator used to combine multiple conditions or filters in queries, rules, or search expressions within the RSS reader application.

public enum LogicalOperator

Fields

AND = 0

All conditions must be satisfied (conjunction).

Effect:

  • Narrows down results significantly.
  • Common in precise filtering: "has tag X AND published after date Y AND contains keyword Z".
  • Higher performance cost in large datasets due to fewer early exits in evaluation.
OR = 1

At least one condition must be satisfied (disjunction).

Effect:

  • Expands result sets (union of matches).
  • Common in discovery/search: "contains keyword A OR keyword B OR keyword C".
  • Usually faster evaluation as any true condition short-circuits the check.

Remarks

This enumeration defines how multiple criteria are evaluated when building complex filters for articles, feeds, or search operations.

Typical usage scenarios include:

  • Combining keyword/tag/category filters in article search or smart feeds
  • Defining inclusion/exclusion rules in custom feed views or notification rules
  • Building advanced filtering logic for dashboards, saved searches, or automation
  • Combining conditions in user-defined rules (e.g., "star articles that match ALL of these tags" vs "ANY")

Business rules and behavioral impact:

  • AND requires **all** specified conditions to be true for the item to match (restrictive/narrowing).
  • OR requires **at least one** condition to be true for the item to match (inclusive/broadening).
  • The operator is usually applied between conditions of the same group/level; nested groups may use different operators.
  • Default behavior in UI (when not explicitly chosen) is typically OR for keyword/tag searches (broader discovery) and AND for strict filtering rules.
  • Changing the operator can dramatically alter result sets — users should be warned when switching between AND/OR in rule editors.
  • In most implementations, this value is stored per-filter-group or per-rule to allow mixed logic (e.g., (A AND B) OR C).

Recommendation: When exposing this in UI, label clearly as "All of these" (AND) vs "Any of these" (OR) to improve user understanding and reduce configuration errors.
